Question
========

The factorial ANCOVA is an omnibus test and gives a statistically significant result. If you want to know which group averages are statistically significantly different from each other you can: 
Answerlist
----------
* Perform contrasts and post hoc analyses on the adjusted averages.
* Perform contrasts only, the post-hoc analyses are no longer reliable.
* Perform both contrasts and post-hoc analyses on the unadjusted averages.
* Run only post-hoc analyses.

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------
* Correct
* Incorrect
* Incorrect
* Incorrect
